metadata.title: CVE-2022-1312 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in storage in Google Chrome prior to 100.0.4896.88 allowedan attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension topotentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
